intro: Sumacus montana, commonly known as the Andean mountain hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Andes. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to deep red. Its leaves are palmately lobed and often have a hairy texture. Sumacus montana thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in cloud forests.
